actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, January 30, 2025,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, January 30, 2025, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today .

PN11-2:
        Pamela Bondi, of Florida, to be Attorney General

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 46. Record Vote Number: 31 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate 2/4/2025.


 PN11-15:
        Christopher Wright, of Colorado, to be Secretary of Energy

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 59 - 38. Record Vote Number: 30 



 PN11-22:
        Russell Vought, of Virginia, to be Director of the Office of Management and Budget

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 46. Record Vote Number: 29 


        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
Under the authority of the order of today, at  8:47 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Schmitt in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 11 a.m. tomorrow .
